verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489>, and said <WH559>,
Should a wise man <WH2450> make answer <WH6030> with vain <WH7307> knowledge <WH1847>, And fill <WH4390> himself <WH990> with the east wind <WH6921>?
Should he reason <WH3198> with unprofitable <WH5532> talk <WH1697>, Or with speeches <WH4405> wherewith he can do no good <WH3276>?
Yea <WH6565>, thou doest away with fear <WH3374>, And hinderest <WH1639> devotion <WH7881> before <WH6440> God <WH410>.
For thine iniquity <WH5771> teacheth <WH502> thy mouth <WH6310>, And thou choosest <WH977> the tongue <WH3956> of the crafty <WH6175>.
Thine own mouth <WH6310> condemneth <WH7561> thee <WH8193>, and not I; Yea, thine own lips testify against thee <WH6030>.
Art thou the first <WH7223> man <WH120> that was born <WH3205>? Or wast thou brought <WH2342> forth before <WH6440> the hills <WH1389>?
Hast thou heard <WH8085> the secret <WH5475> counsel of God <WH433>? And dost thou limit <WH1639> wisdom to thyself <WH2451>?
What knowest <WH3045> thou <WH3045>, that we know not <WH995>? What understandest thou, which is not in us?
With us are both the gray-headed <WH7867> and the very aged <WH3453> men <WH3524>, Much elder <WH3117> than thy father <WH1>.
Are the consolations <WH8575> of God <WH410> too small <WH4592> for thee <WH1697>, Even the word that is gentle toward thee <WH328>?
Why doth thy heart <WH3820> carry thee away <WH3947>? And why do thine eyes <WH5869> flash <WH7335>,
That against God <WH410> thou turnest <WH7725> thy spirit <WH7307>, And lettest words <WH4405> go out <WH3318> of thy mouth <WH6310>?
What is man <WH582>, that he should be clean <WH2135>? And he that is born <WH3205> of a woman <WH802>, that he should be righteous <WH6663>?
Behold <WH539>, he putteth no trust in his holy <WH6918> ones <WH8064>; Yea, the heavens are not clean <WH2141> in his sight <WH5869>:
How much less one <WH376> that is abominable <WH8581> and corrupt <WH376>, A man that drinketh <WH8354> iniquity <WH5766> like water <WH4325>!
I will show <WH2331> thee <WH8085>, hear thou me <WH2372>; And that which I have seen I will declare <WH5608>:
(Which wise <WH2450> men have told <WH5046> From their fathers <WH1>, and have not hid it <WH3582>;
Unto whom alone the land <WH776> was given <WH5414>, And no stranger <WH2114> passed <WH5674> among them <WH8432>):
The wicked <WH7563> man travaileth <WH2342> with pain all his days <WH3117>, Even the number <WH4557> of years <WH8141> that are laid <WH6845> up for the oppressor <WH6184>.
A sound <WH6963> of terrors <WH6343> is in his ears <WH241>; In prosperity <WH7965> the destroyer <WH7703> shall come upon him <WH935>.
He believeth <WH539> not that he shall return <WH7725> out of darkness <WH2822>, And he is waited <WH6822> for of the sword <WH2719>.
He wandereth abroad <WH5074> for bread <WH3899>, saying <WH3045>, Where is it? He knoweth that the day <WH3117> of darkness <WH2822> is ready <WH3559> at his hand <WH3027>.
Distress <WH6862> and anguish <WH4691> make him afraid <WH1204>; They prevail <WH8630> against him <WH4428>, as a king ready <WH6264> to the battle <WH3593>.
Because he hath stretched out <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against God <WH410>, And behaveth himself proudly <WH1396> against the Almighty <WH7706>;
He runneth <WH7323> upon him with a stiff neck <WH6677>, With the thick <WH5672> bosses <WH1354> of his bucklers <WH4043>;
Because he hath covered <WH3680> his face <WH6440> with his fatness <WH2459>, And gathered <WH6213> fat <WH6371> upon his loins <WH3689>;
And he hath dwelt <WH7931> in desolate <WH3582> cities <WH5892>, In houses <WH1004> which no man inhabited <WH3427>, Which were ready <WH6257> to become heaps <WH1530>;
He shall not be rich <WH6238>, neither shall his substance <WH2428> continue <WH6965>, Neither shall their possessions <WH5186> be extended <WH4512> on the earth <WH776>.
He shall not depart <WH5493> out of darkness <WH2822>; The flame <WH7957> shall dry up <WH3001> his branches <WH3127>, And by the breath <WH7307> of God <WH6310>'s mouth shall he go away <WH5493>.
Let him not trust <WH539> in vanity <WH7723>, deceiving <WH8582> himself <WH7723>; For vanity shall be his recompense <WH8545>.
It shall be accomplished <WH4390> before <WH3808> his time <WH3117>, And his branch <WH3712> shall not be green <WH7488>.
He shall shake off <WH2554> his unripe grape <WH1154> as the vine <WH1612>, And shall cast off <WH7993> his flower <WH5328> as the olive-tree <WH2132>.
For the company <WH5712> of the godless <WH2611> shall be barren <WH1565>, And fire <WH784> shall consume <WH398> the tents <WH168> of bribery <WH7810>.
They conceive <WH2029> mischief <WH5999>, and bring forth <WH3205> iniquity <WH205>, And their heart <WH990> prepareth <WH3559> deceit <WH4820>.
